CatDescriptText: Miss Helen Stout, typist, 804 Fourth Avenue, Coraopolis, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 19, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that cab drivers in general take advantage of other motorists and pedestrians in traffic? As a group, would you call them courteous or discourteous?" answer reads: "Yes, I do.  They act this way seemingly because they are part of a company organization.  As a whole, they are discourteous."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Helen Stout wearing pleated skirt and dark cardigan sweater, holding dark rectangular handbag, leaning against car, building and telephone poles in background
